dialogueLines.line: Hi, welcome to Coffin Cafe!
Oh... hello, dear. I suppose you must be Rehema, the Grim Reaper's new helper. Quite a peculiar name, if you ask me.
It's memorable, right? What can I get for you today?
I'm not sure, to be honest. I suppose I'd like something to... take the edge off this heaviness in my heart. It's been so long since I felt... warmth.
I think I have just the thing! One Celestial Cocoa, coming right up.
You should not have come here...
Uh... maybe I took a wrong turn?
No... I mean, I do not belong here. I should have moved on long ago, but something keeps me tied.
Maybe I can help. Tell me—what's keeping you here?
I... I never told her how much she meant to me. My sister, Eleanor. She thought I hated her... but I didn't. I just didn't know how to say it.
Maybe there's a way we can fix that. Let's start with a Twilight Velvet to soothe your mind.
I can't remember the last time I felt truly alive...
Sometimes, a little warmth can bring things back to life. What can I make for you today?
Maybe something comforting... something to remind me of the stars.
I know just the drink. A Dreamcatcher it is!
The world is so dark... I don't know where I'm going.
That sounds tough. Would you like something to help clear your mind?
Maybe... something strong. Something to wake me up from this endless fog.
How about a Midnight Frost? It's bold and invigorating!
I've been wandering this place for so long... I've lost all my connections.
I understand. Maybe a warm drink can help you find some peace. What do you feel like today?
Something soothing... something that reminds me of peace.
A Moonlit Comfort would be just right for you.
Time doesn't seem to pass here... I feel... stuck.
It can be hard to move on. Maybe a drink can ease your burden.
Something that can help me forget this endless drift... something sweet.
I have just the thing. One Eclipsed Mocha, coming right up!
I am not sure who I am anymore...
It's okay to feel lost sometimes. What can I get you today?
Maybe something fiery... something that makes me feel alive again.
How about a Sunfire Espresso? It'll warm your spirit!
I'm so tired... but I can't rest.
Rest is hard to find sometimes. Can I make something that'll help you feel at ease?
Something light... something that can help me drift into a peaceful sleep.
I think a Lunar Bloom is just what you need.
I have been waiting for someone... for so long.
Waiting is hard, especially when it feels endless. How can I help?
Perhaps a drink to help me feel connected... to feel at peace.
I think a Starry Drip would bring you the peace you're looking for.
I've had enough of this! You think you can fix me with your drinks? Prepare yourself!
Whoa, what's going on? I just wanted to help you...!
No more sympathy, no more warmth! If you want to defeat me, you'll have to face me in the rhythm of battle!
A rhythm battle? Alright... bring it on!
This place… it stirs something in me. A warmth I thought I'd lost long ago.
Could be the fire. The way it crackles—it has a way of waking up old memories, doesn't it?
It reminds me of sitting by the hearth on a rainy night, wrapped in quiet, safe from the storm. I long for that again—something that feels like home.
An Ember's Hollow might be just the thing to bring that memory back to life, if only for a moment.
The past clings to me like mist. No matter how I try, I can't seem to face it fully.
Some memories run too deep to hold all at once. Maybe a drink could help you see their shape—without letting them drown you.
Yes… something that carries the weight of what was. Something that gives form to the shadowy thoughts that lurk in the corners of my mind.
An Obsidian Reign, then. It won't banish the past, but it might help you stand with it.
I keep hoping for something... even though I don't quite know what it is.
Hope's a stubborn thing. It hangs around even when the world stops making sense—like a stubborn ember refusing to die out.
Maybe you have something that can help me believe again?
Absolutely. I'll make you an Abyssal Bloom. It won't tell you what to believe—but it might help you remember how.
Whenever I reach for a memory, it slips through my fingers like fog. I'm left holding nothing but the ache of it.
Not all memories need to be grasped tightly. Some are meant to drift… and be felt rather than remembered.
Then I want something soft. Something that doesn't force me to face past but lets it quietly sit beside me.
I've got just the thing— a Crimson Haze to let your unrest fade away.
So much stillness… and it stretches endlessly. The weight of eternity is unbearable, and all I can do is wait.
Stillness can be peaceful... or painful. Depends on what you're waiting for.
I want something quiet. Something that serves as a companion in the hush between endings and beginnings.
Hmm… I have a few drinks in mind. Let's see what speaks to your silence.
I've drifted so far, I'm not even sure I'm real anymore. I just… need something to tell me I still exist.
You are real. Even when you're lost in the dark, the light remembers you. You just need to feel its touch again.
Then I wish for a spark of light... enough to remind me I still exist, even if just for a moment.
A Radiance should do the trick.
These wounds... they cling to me. I don't even know if they're mine anymore, but I carry them still.
Sometimes it's not about the weight itself, but the way we hold it. Maybe it's time to see it from a new angle.
I don't want to be rid of it, not really. I just want... relief. A gentler way forward.
Then try The Shifting. It won't erase what's there, but it might show you a different path through it.
You don't have to say anything if you're not ready. Sometimes silence holds the deepest truths.
Let me make you a Faded Silence. It's a drink that offers solace to the quiet.
There's so much noise in my mind… thoughts chasing each other, overlapping, unraveling—I can't make sense of any of it.
Sounds like your spirit's caught in a storm. Maybe what you need isn't an answer, but a pause.
I keep reaching... for something I can't name. Like if I just think hard enough, I'll finally remember what I've forgotten.
Not everything comes from thinking. Some truths settle in when we stop chasing them.
Then maybe I need something calming. Something that hushes the noise without silencing the questions.
I've got just the thing. Let's try to bring a little stillness to the searching.
So you're the one they whisper about... the brewer who thinks kindness can cure centuries of rot.
I don't claim to cure anything. But sometimes a warm cup can reach where words can't.
Hah! What nonsense. These ghosts are broken, twisted— *I* am twisted. Your sympathy is wasted on wretches like me.
Maybe. But even bitterness stems from pain. I'm not here to force peace on you… just to offer a moment of quiet, if you want it.
Save your pity. If you want to reach me, you'll have to fight through the storm I've become. Rhythm for rhythm, beat for beat—if you dare.
Then let the music do the talking. I'm not afraid of a challenge.
I feel raging fire trapped in my head. It's never going out... no matter how much I try to smother it.
That anger—it's like an endless fire. What's been feeding it?
Everything! It's like I'm stuck in a loop—fighting, but never getting anywhere. Everything I see just makes the flames flare higher.
It sounds like you need something strong to jolt your system out of it: A Nightshock.
I wander, lost in the memories of warmth... But all I find is cold, hollow emptiness.
Memories like that are hard to hold onto, especially when everything around you feels so distant. What do you miss the most?
It's the feeling of comfort—of being home, grounded in something that feels familiar and safe.
I think I have something that might bring you that sense of warmth... Earthbound.
My voice... it's lost beneath the waves of sorrow. Every word feels distant, like it's slipping away before it can be heard.
That sorrow—it can make everything feel so far away, so hard to reach. When everything feels muffled, what would make you feel heard again?
I just want to find a moment of silence... a stillness where everything fades and I can breathe again.
I have just what you need. A Mistlock will still the world around you, giving you the peace you crave.
I've stared at my reflection for so long that I don't recognize myself anymore. It's like I've become a ghost of what I once was.
Mirrors can be cruel, especially when they show only fragments of who we were. What do you see when you look at yourself?
I see pieces—half of a person, lost in the cracks. I don't know who I've become anymore.
Maybe you need to see yourself through someone else's eyes. A Reflection's End will help you recognize who you've become.
I'm stuck here... the past haunts me, blurring everything in front of me. I can't escape it, no matter how hard I try.
The past has a way of holding us captive, doesn't it? But sometimes, we need to let go, let something else help clear the way.
If only I could feel free again... Everything I once knew is slipping through my fingers like sand. I need something that'll break these chains.
Maybe it's time for something to help you see clearly again. Something that can lift the fog.
I'm caught between two worlds... the past is long gone, but I can't fully step into today. I find myself in a gap between time, in a space where I don't quite belong.
It's hard, isn't it? Being torn between who you were and who you are now. What are you searching for in this moment?
Something that can blend the two—that can tie the past to the present and help me feel whole again.
Blending the past with the present… I think I know just the thing to help you find that balance.
The past lingers in my mind... nostalgia, love, promises that faded. How did I get here? Everything I once had is slipping away.
Nostalgia can be a heavy thing, pulling us backward when we're trying to move forward. What do you miss most from those days?
The warmth of things once so full of life. I need something that can remind me of that feeling.
I think I know just the drink to bring back those memories.
I can't remember where I came from... everything feels so fractured. I wander with no destination in mind.
It's hard when the past slips away and leaves us wandering, isn't it? What do you think would help you find your way again?
Something that could ground me, something rooted in nature—something that reminds me of where I came from, even if I can't recall it.
I think I can make something for you...
The weight of it... it never leaves. Grief follows me like a shadow, pressing down on me. I just want to feel something else, even if it's for a moment.
I can see that sorrow in your eyes... Grief can be suffocating. What would help you breathe again, even if just for a little while?
Something light, something that could lift the weight off my chest, if only for a brief moment. I just need a break from the sorrow.
I think I have just the thing to help you feel better.
Oh great. Another savior with a smile and a teacup. Spare me the sermon.
I'm not here to save you. Just offering a drink, if you want it.
Want. That's funny. I stopped wanting things a long time ago. They just turn to ash anyway.
That sounds like someone who used to care an awful lot.
Don't dig around in me like there's something left to rescue. If you really think there's meaning in all this... prove it.
Face me in a rhythm battle. Beat me or stop pretending to help people.
I don't pretend. Let's speak in the only language you still trust—music.
